title: Chris Thompson in tears when talking about Jay Gruden's future
text:
FEDEX FIELD -- Since the days leading up to the Redskins falling handily to the New England Patriots on Sunday -- Washington's fifth loss in a row -- the job security of head coach Jay Gruden has been in question.

Following the 33-7 loss to New England, Redskins running back Chris Thompson was asked about Gruden's future in Washington. The running back's emotions quickly came out.

Thompson fought back tears as he described his relationship with the sixth-year head coach.

Scroll to continue with content Ad

"I feel like he was one of the guys that really believed in me, and wanted me to stay here and be with him through his whole legacy here as a coach," Thompson said.

Thompson was drafted by Washington in the fifth round of the 2013 draft, a year before Gruden took over as the Redskins head coach. Thompson was initially cut by the Redskins on roster cutdown day in 2014, but was added to the team's practice squad. He was promoted to the active roster in December of 2014 and never looked back.

"Going through that practice squad year, it was real tough for me," Thompson continued. "It's tough, man."

Over the past five seasons with Gruden at the helm, Thompson has established himself as one of the best pass-catching running backs around the league.

Thompson has spent his entire career with the Burgundy and Gold and continues to have a vital role in the team's offense.
